result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Castine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of the sentence, payment of all costs and fees and no new criminal law violations.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  Surcharge imposed.
 If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber, non working hours with standard release conditions.  STAYED  To be used at Agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 61 days were granted. Time Served.
Costs previously imposed were converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Charles E Castine in court with Attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Chesshir makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Robert J. makes statements.  Cour sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs /drug paraphernalia
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.** 

CONDITION TIME:  20 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

** Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
